nodes.text: An IoT based system using Node MCU and Wi-Fi can implement integrated smart home automation and smart security that overcomes range and reliability drawbacks of Bluetooth, ZigBee and GSM based methods
The proposed system architecture uses Node MCU as the central IoT board, Arduino UNO for the camera, sensors (IR, DHT11, MQ135), relay board for appliances, and Wi-Fi or 3G/4G for remote access
The system provides smart security by detecting motion with an IR sensor, activating a camera, storing captured images on a PC folder, and sending the captured image to the owner via email
The system provides home automation by controlling lights and fans via relay interface controlled by Node MCU and allowing remote user commands over the Internet or cellular data
The system performs environment monitoring: DHT11 reports temperature and humidity and MQ135 reports air purity; readings update approximately every second on the user smartphone
Hardware components include Node MCU (ESP8266 based, 128 KB memory, 16 GPIO), Arduino UNO (ATmega328), OV7670 camera, IR sensor, DHT11, MQ135, and 5V 4-channel relay board
Camera module is connected to Arduino UNO because Node MCU has only one analog pin and the OV7670 requires multiple analog/parallel signals
System uses Blink app on a smartphone to display results and a web/email mechanism to transmit alerts and captured images to a predefined owner email
When IR sensor detects motion the microcontroller triggers the camera, the image is captured, stored on a PC folder and emailed to the owner stating possible intruder
After receiving the captured image the owner can remotely command the system to turn on lights/fans or forward the image to police via SMS if intruder is identified
Relays controlled by the microcontroller can switch AC appliances (rated AC250V 10A) allowing remote activation of lights and fans
Remote control operates over Wi-Fi and, if Wi-Fi is unavailable, over 3G or 4G cellular data to allow long distance control

DHT11 and MQ135 continuously send humidity, temperature and air quality values to the Node MCU and these values are displayed on the smartphone; high temperature or poor air quality can trigger fan activation
Prototype implementation results are visible in the Blink app and captured OV7670 images are successfully stored and emailed to the user
Advantages of the implemented system include low cost, support for handicapped and aged users, long distance control, improved security and time savings
Limitation: the system depends on internet or cellular connectivity to provide remote functionality, and future work could port the design to alternative platforms such as Raspberry Pi
